fields.title: Installing Python
fields.content:
Installing Python on Windows

Download the latest version from python.org. Run the installer and make sure to check 'Add Python to PATH'.

Installing on Mac

Use Homebrew: brew install python

Installing on Linux

Use apt: sudo apt install python3

fields.title: Your First Python Script
fields.content: Learn to write your first Hello World program and understand Python syntax.

fields.title: Variables and Data Types
fields.content:
What are Variables?

Variables are containers for storing data values. Python has no command for declaring a variable.

Data Types

  • int - Integer numbers
  • float - Decimal numbers
  • str - Text strings
  • bool - True/False

fields.title: Python Basics Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of Python basics.

fields.title: If Statements
fields.content:
Conditional Statements

Python uses if, elif, and else for decision making.

if x > 0:
    print('Positive')
elif x < 0:
    print('Negative')
else:
    print('Zero')

fields.title: Control Flow Quiz
fields.content: Test your understanding of control flow.

fields.title: What is React?
fields.content:
Introduction to React

React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It was developed by Facebook and is now maintained by Meta.

Key Features

  • Component-based architecture
  • Virtual DOM for performance
  • Declarative programming
  • Large ecosystem

fields.title: Creating Components
fields.content: Learn how to create functional and class components in React.

fields.title: useState Hook
fields.content:
Managing State with useState

The useState hook allows you to add state to functional components.

const [count, setCount] = useState(0);

fields.title: React Hooks Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of React hooks.

fields.title: Context API
fields.content:
Global State with Context

Context provides a way to pass data through the component tree without manually passing props.

fields.title: State Management Quiz
fields.content: Test your understanding of state management.

fields.title: Importing Libraries
fields.content:
Essential ML Libraries

NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn are the core libraries for machine learning in Python.

import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

fields.title: Handling Missing Data
fields.content: Learn techniques to handle missing values in your dataset.

fields.title: Simple Linear Regression
fields.content:
Linear Regression

Linear regression is used to predict a continuous output variable based on one or more input features.

Formula: y = mx + b

fields.title: Regression Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of regression algorithms.

fields.title: Logistic Regression
fields.content:
Classification with Logistic Regression

Despite its name, logistic regression is used for classification problems. It predicts probabilities between 0 and 1.

fields.title: Classification Quiz
fields.content: Test your understanding of classification algorithms.

fields.title: What is Django?
fields.content:
Django Overview

Django is a high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development. It follows the MVT (Model-View-Template) architecture pattern.

Key Features

  • Built-in admin interface
  • ORM for database operations
  • Security features out of the box
  • Scalable and maintainable

fields.title: Creating Your First Project
fields.content: Learn to create and configure a Django project from scratch.

fields.title: Django Models
fields.content:
Creating Models

Models are Python classes that define your database structure.

class Article(models.Model):
    title = models.CharField(max_length=200)
    content = models.TextField()
    created_at = models.DateTimeField(auto_now_add=True)

fields.title: Django Models Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of Django models.

fields.title: Class-Based Views
fields.content:
CBV in Django

Class-based views provide reusable components for common patterns like ListView, DetailView, CreateView, etc.

fields.title: Views Quiz
fields.content: Test your understanding of Django views.

fields.title: Introduction to Containers
fields.content:
What are Containers?

Containers are lightweight, standalone, executable packages that include everything needed to run an application. They share the OS kernel but run in isolation.

fields.title: Building Docker Images
fields.content: Learn to create Dockerfiles and build custom images.

fields.title: Docker Compose Basics
fields.content:
Multi-Container Apps

Docker Compose allows you to define and run multi-container applications with a YAML file.

version: '3'
services:
  web:
    build: .
  db:
    image: postgres

fields.title: Docker Compose Quiz
fields.content: Test your Docker Compose knowledge.

fields.title: Kubernetes Overview
fields.content:
What is Kubernetes?

Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source container orchestration platform that automates deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

fields.title: Kubernetes Quiz
fields.content: Test your Kubernetes knowledge.

fields.title: SELECT Statement
fields.content:
Querying Data

The SELECT statement is used to retrieve data from a database.

SELECT column1, column2 FROM table_name WHERE condition;

fields.title: CRUD Operations
fields.content: Learn INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE operations.

fields.title: SQL JOINs
fields.content:
Combining Tables

JOINs are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column.

Types of JOINs

  • INNER JOIN
  • LEFT JOIN
  • RIGHT JOIN
  • FULL OUTER JOIN

fields.title: JOINs Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of SQL JOINs.

fields.title: Database Normalization
fields.content:
Normalization

Database normalization is the process of organizing data to minimize redundancy. Common forms: 1NF, 2NF, 3NF.

fields.title: Design Quiz
fields.content: Test your database design knowledge.

fields.title: Introduction to Vue
fields.content:
What is Vue.js?

Vue.js is a progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It's designed to be incrementally adoptable.

Key Features

  • Reactive data binding
  • Component-based architecture
  • Virtual DOM
  • Easy to learn

fields.title: Vue Directives
fields.content: Learn v-if, v-for, v-bind, and v-model directives.

fields.title: ref and reactive
fields.content:
Reactivity Fundamentals

Vue 3 introduces ref() and reactive() for creating reactive state in Composition API.

const count = ref(0)
const state = reactive({ name: 'Vue' })

fields.title: Composition API Quiz
fields.content: Test your Composition API knowledge.

fields.title: Pinia Basics
fields.content:
State Management with Pinia

Pinia is the recommended state management library for Vue 3. It provides stores for global state.

fields.title: State Management Quiz
fields.content: Test your state management knowledge.

fields.title: Why TypeScript?
fields.content:
TypeScript Overview

TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing. It helps catch errors early and improves code quality.

Benefits

  • Type safety
  • Better IDE support
  • Self-documenting code
  • Easier refactoring

fields.title: Basic Types
fields.content: Learn string, number, boolean, array, and object types.

fields.title: Generics
fields.content:
Generic Types

Generics allow you to create reusable components that work with multiple types.

function identity(arg: T): T {
  return arg;
}

fields.title: Generics Quiz
fields.content: Test your knowledge of TypeScript generics.

fields.title: TypeScript with React
fields.content:
React + TypeScript

TypeScript works great with React, providing type safety for props, state, and hooks.

fields.title: Framework Integration Quiz
fields.content: Test your TypeScript framework integration knowledge.

fields.title: Getting Started with React Native
fields.content:
What is React Native?

React Native is a framework for building native mobile apps using React and JavaScript. Write once, run on both iOS and Android.

fields.title: Core Components
fields.content: Learn View, Text, Image, ScrollView, and other core components.

fields.title: React Navigation Setup
fields.content:
Navigation in React Native

React Navigation is the most popular navigation library for React Native. It supports stack, tab, and drawer navigation.

fields.title: Navigation Quiz
fields.content: Test your React Navigation knowledge.

fields.title: Using Camera API
fields.content:
Accessing Device Camera

React Native allows you to access native device features like the camera through native modules or libraries like expo-camera.

fields.title: Native Features Quiz
fields.content: Test your native features knowledge.
